content.description:
IMAGE 1: SAINT LAWRENCE RIVER VALLEY, QUEBEC, CANADA

IMAGE 2: VALE OF THE WHITE HORSE, OXFORDSHIRE, UNITED KINGDOM

Source: Esri Data Partners

The remotely sensed images show the outcomes of different rural land survey methods.
content.question:
A. Describe ONE similarity between the land survey methods that resulted in the spatial patterns shown in Image 1 and Image 2.

B. Describe a disadvantage of the land survey method used in the St. Lawrence River valley.

C. Explain how the land use patterns shown in Image 2 may create a sense of place in contemporary rural communities.

D. Explain how a growing demand for organic products in Oxfordshire may affect agricultural practices in this area.

E. Explain ONE reason why remotely sensed images are useful for rural landscape analysis.

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Explain how maps, images, and landscapes illustrate, or relate to geographic principles, processes, and outcomes.
